alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 6:59AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...AN INTENSE BAND OF LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF JEFFERSON, OSWEGO, AND LEWIS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of very heavy lake effect snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing very heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour in the heart of the band, with up to 4 inches per hour locally, especially from just north of Adams Center, north through the Watertown area to near Fort Drum extending inland across the northern Tug Hill. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 655 AM EST, an intense band of lake effect snow was located from just north of Adams Center to Watertown to near Fort Drum and extending inland across the northern Tug Hill. This band has oscillated northward into the Watertown area over the past hour, however areas around Ellisburg and Mannsville may see a return of heavy snow over the next hour or so as the band oscillates a bit. Heavy snow will impact the Watertown area morning commute. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Watertown, Fort Drum, Stony Point, Carthage, Lowville, West Carthage, Adams, Dexter, Glen Park, Herrings, Highmarket, Adams Center, Southwick Beach State Park, Henderson Harbor, Barnes Corners, Whetstone Gulf State Park, Denmark, New Bremen, Watson, and Sackets Harbor. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 37 and 48. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
